definitions.definition: To pass an iron over ( clothing or some other item made of cloth ) in order to remove creases .
examples: You'd be wise to iron that shirt before you wear it.

definitions.definition: To engage in such pressing of clothing.
examples: They were washing and ironing all morning.

definitions.definition: To shackle with irons ; to fetter or handcuff .
To furnish , clad , or arm with iron.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To pass an iron over ( clothing or some other item made of cloth ) in order to remove creases .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To engage in such pressing of clothing.
( transitive , archaic ) To shackle with irons ; to fetter or handcuff .
( transitive ) To furnish , clad , or arm with iron.
